nana.description: Nana was in town for a few days.  Felix jumped into her arms right away.
nana.title: Nana

nounours1.description: Out and about with Nounours the bear.
nounours1.title: Nounours 1

nounours2.description: Nournours watches Felix's mastery of the sandbox.
nounours2.title: Nounours 2

nounours3.description: Nournours listens in on Lucie reading at the library.  Kids fluttered to her like moths to a lightbulb.
nounours3.title: Nounours 3

party_1.description: Felix is a few days shy of being two years old.   That didn't stop us from holding a birthday bash.
party_1.title: Party 1

party_2.description: Cavorting in a porta-crib filled with balloons.
party_2.title: Party 2

party_austin1.description: Austin is the first guest to arrive.
party_austin1.title: Party Austin 1

party_guests1.description: Lucie, Amy, Amanda and Terry scarf a delicious banana nut cake.
party_guests1.title: Party Guests 1

party_guests2.description: Jennifer, Dan, Mike, and Lucie wonder if the kids will ever run down.
party_guests2.title: Party Guests 2

party_guests4.description: Mike and Felix play "put the adult in the tunnel".
party_guests4.title: Party Guests 4

party_hearty1.description: Terry and Felix share a moment.
party_hearty1.title: Party Hearty 1

party_wish1.description: The first lighting of the candle was a thrilling rollercoaster:  Felix tried and tried, and in succeeding nearly burnt his nose!
party_wish1.title: Party Wish 1

party_wish2.description: There was 2 cakes, since the birthday boy was 2. The blowing of the candle was easier the second time around.
party_wish2.title: Party Wish 2

party_wish3.description: April and her daughter Anna (who goes to Sylvie's), Felix, Dean and Jenifer.  Jennifer is Nate's mom. Nate is too busy going through Felix's toys to appear on the photos.
party_wish3.title: Party Wish 3

present_ark.description: Nana gave Felix a Noah's Ark. From Great Grandma came many ark animals.  He hasn't had much play time with them because Lucie keeps stealing them for herself.
present_ark.title: Present Ark

present_toolbox.description: Great Grandpa gave Felix a tool box.   Felix immediately started building cars and planes with it (at least that's what he says they are).   He especially loves the hammer. Thankfully, he quickly accepted the fact that he is allowed to bang as hard as he wants on the toolbox, but, on anything else, he has to "pretend" (i.e. tap very gently).
present_toolbox.title: Present Toolbox

umbrella1.description: Felix got matching boots and umbrella. He is extremely proud of them.
umbrella1.title: Umbrella 1

umbrella2.description: Watch out, rain, here he comes.
umbrella2.title: Umbrella 2

umbrella3.description: You may notice that it is not actually raining on this picture. The first couple of days, Felix insisted on taking his umbrella everywhere; and on putting on his boots the instant he climbed out of his crib in the morning.
umbrella3.title: Umbrella 3

description:
Felix has been a super kid lately. He's been increasingly jolly, laughing and smiley.

A few weeks ago, he started being willfully disobedient and watching us to see how we'd respond. We responded with "time outs", where we forcibly held him in a chair until he agreed to cooperate. We only used them when he was being intentionally and provocatively disobedient. We made sure we were consistent, and made sure we won each battle. Happily, there ended up being only four battles: now, just the threat of a timeout when he's trying to provoke us makes him cooperate, and quickly. Each battle happened to be in a different room of the house: it looks like he was figuring out if the rules varied geographically? Anyway, he was a quick learner and if that's the end of it for us, we'll count ourselves extremely lucky.

Similarly, we started actually brushing his teeth, rather than handing him a toothbrush and letting him lick the baby toothpaste off. For a few days it was a strap-the-kid down torture procedure, but now he lets us get in there and scrub those pearly whites, and kind of enjoys it.

On the language side, his nouns are pretty bilingual, but his verbs are mostly English. His favorite use of verbs is to boss us around. Common verbs: go, stop, stay, wait, see, open, help. And he has the cutest "Here you go!" when he hands us stuff.
title: December 7
